title: Detect All-Type Deepfake Audio: Wavelet Prompt Tuning for Enhanced Auditory Perception
author: Yuankun Xie (Communication University of China), Xiaopeng Wang (University of Chinese Academy of Sciences), Ruibo Fu (Chinese Academy of Sciences), Songjun Cao (Tencent), Zhiyong Wang (University of Chinese Academy of Sciences), Long Ma (Tencent), Haonnan Cheng (Communication University of China), Long Ye (Communication University of China)
relevance_why: The proposed methodologies in this paper can directly inform techniques for audio quality enhancement, crucial for Dr. Liu's work on audio processing and restoration, particularly in capturing type-invariant information useful for various audio deepfakes.
background: The study focuses on the challenge of detecting various types of deepfake audio (speech, sound, singing, music) using a novel training approach that reduces reliance on extensive training parameters.
contribution: This paper introduces the Wavelet Prompt Tuning Self-Supervised Learning (WPT-SSL) paradigm to enhance audio deepfake detection capabilities across multiple audio types, achieving an average Equal Error Rate (EER) of 3.58%.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing methods typically fine-tune large models which require significant training resources and specific parameter settings.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work minimizes parameter requirements by incorporating prompt tuning, allowing for better performance across various audio types without extensive retraining.

key_innovation: The introduction of wavelet approach in prompt tuning allows capturing frequency-distributed features critical for identifying deepfake audio, contributing to a comprehensive audio analysis.
real_world_impact: This research has implications for improving security in multimedia applications and content verification processes, addressing growing concerns about audio misinformation.

new_terms.Wavelet Prompt Tuning: **Wavelet Prompt Tuning** refers to a new method in which prompts are adjusted based on wavelet transforms to improve feature extraction for audio deepfake detection.
new_terms.Equal Error Rate (EER): **Equal Error Rate (EER)** is a performance measure in detection tasks that indicates the point where the false acceptance rate and false rejection rate are equal, serving as a critical evaluation metric.
